subject: RE: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... That s not going to help: - Either setUp() succeeds and all your tests are run (and in this case, they will fail) - Or setUp() fails and JUnit still
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> > partial failures of setUp are not handled properly (and they will
> > flag all the tests as "FAILURES", which is incorrect: the tests were
> > simply not run and the error is in setUp(), not in the test
> methods).
>
> So we wrap setup()'s content in a try block?

That's not going to help:

- Either setUp() succeeds and all your tests are run (and in this case, they
will fail)
- Or setUp() fails and JUnit still invokes your tests anyway (and they will
fail)

This is why I introduced a third status in TestNG: "SKIPPED".

If a setUp() method or a test method you depend on fails, then the tests
will not be run and marked SKIPPED, so you don't waste time investigating
them.

--
CÃ©dric
